Description of what is happening
This could be a headline or a label, describing whether that empty state was caused by
an error or simply because the user hasn't entered any information yet.
Call to action
In many cases, an empty state can provide suggestions of what the user could do next
to obtain results. For instance, if a search returned no results, the call to action could
invite users to try different search terms or check their spelling. This call to action can
be textual or an interactive element.
Illustration
Illustrations should be used sparingly, but can be used alongside empty states to
impart a more positive tone to what otherwise could be perceived as an error state. If
using an illustration for an empty state, make sure to not overcrowd the interface with
other competing moments.
Alternative states
In many cases, the empty state of a page or component can provide alternatives to
what users can do next. That could mean instructing the users on next steps, or even
suggesting alternative content that could get users engaged.
Starter content
In pages like an empty cart, it's a good idea to use the opportunity to suggest a few
things for users to do, such as signing in to see saved items, popular products or
different categories users can browse.
